Name: Coptic textile
Description: A border fragment from a natural wool robe, with indigo decoration. The motif consists of guilloche borders enclosing an interlaced band which divides into a central guilloche band. This in turn is enclosed by further guilloche and overlapping vine leaf bands joined at the ends by a formal floral design.Technique: tapestry with built-up shapes, curved weft, slits, 'soumak' decoration and squared dove-tailing.Ends per inch (warp threads): 24.Picks per inch (weft threads): 128.
